means: 变形，变貌，（耶稣在三个门徒前的）变容

sentence.Network_en: For the brief space that it lasted, it was a dark transfiguration.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那蹙额皱眉的刹那间, 那可真是一种阴森的变脸.

sentence.Network_en: It was a sudden transfiguration , a lifting - up of day.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是突如其来的变形, 是白昼的升华.

sentence.Network_en: It was less a reform than a transfiguration.
sentence.Network_cn: 他这时候与其说是洗面革心,不如说是改头换面.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (with biblical reference): from Old French, or from Latin transfiguratio(n-), from the verb transfigurare (see transfigure)

means.word_mean: 1. a striking change in appearance or character or circumstances;

sentences.sentence: "the metamorphosis of the old house into something new and exciting"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of transforming so as to exalt or glorify
